definition: (of a male) to come of age/an adult male
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth
fourth of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/fourth in order/letter "D" or Roman "IV" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/ancient Chinese compass point: 195°/butyl/cubes (of food)

sentences.english: Sophie:Now wash them, then dice the potatoes and bell peppers. Then slice the meat.
sentences.chinese: 現在把他們都洗乾淨，青椒和土豆切成丁兒，肉切片。
把胡蘿蔔削皮並切成丁。

sentences.english: Cut the sausage and tomato into small pieces.
In the cobb salad, you will find most of these ingredients chopped into cubes.
sentences.chinese: 在科布色拉里，你會發現大部分配料都被切成丁狀。

sentences.english: Dice the chicken breast, carrots and bell pepper.
sentences.chinese: 雞胸肉，甜椒，胡蘿蔔洗淨後分別切成丁狀。

sentences.english: First use a knife to dice the meat, then add 1/4 of a cup of oil.
sentences.chinese: 先用刀把肉切成丁，然後再加四分之一杯食用油。

sentences.english: Chop the mushrooms and quarter the tomatoes.
sentences.chinese: 把蘑菇切成丁，再把西紅柿切成四瓣。

sentences.english: Fry the bacon and cut it into small pieces.
sentences.chinese: 用油煎一下燻肉並切成丁。

sentences.english: They can be sliced and diced for variation.
sentences.chinese: 它們可以被切成丁和變化。

sentences.english: Peel the potatoes and cut them into small pieces.
Alan cubed potatoes to make potato salad.
sentences.chinese: 艾倫將馬鈴薯切成丁，來做馬鈴薯沙拉。

definition: chunks obtained by repeatedly cutting a vegetable diagonally and rotating the vegetable after each cut
to cut up (into pieces)/to slice/to carve/to dice/to shred
to peel/to remove the skin/to tare
to slice/slice/thin section of a specimen (for microscopic examination)
